Hey, funny story. About a week ago my rib, almost completely healed, starting hurting a LOT again. Felt it "clicking." Went to a doc, and he said it's a break and the two sides are rubbing past each other. Neat, I broke it twice in the same place! Not even sure how I did it!
But the good news is that he recommended continuing to do EVERYTHING, including kiteboarding (albeit with rigging some foam around the problem). He says the bone rubbing actually encourages healing (maybe chemical signal?) and keeping moving through full range of motion, despite pain, is a good thing. I choose to believe all that.
Doc thought I was stupid to request an x-ray, which he said told him nothing. He said when people report clicking, it's definitely a break. Sure enough, he couldn't explain anything on the xray. He said, "Well, it could have broken in the same place or somewhere else."
Do not go gentle into that good night.
So I did it…and solo’d again in a power plane for the first time in about 40 (FORTY) years.
Got a horrible upper back wrenching, seeing doc Monday, haven't gotten much sleep because I yell in pain all night!
Thank you! I will set this in motion. THis is just too pathetic.
Worst day/night yet. Lots of spasms, crawling. Taking every drug. Anti-spasm drugs are totally useless!
Back: gave up on bed after midnight last night because it was too painful and went down to Studio and slept on the chair.
GREAT idea re: blood test. I'm asking my doc right now. I have years of baseline to compare it with. What dosage of nsaids do you take per day?

So I convinced my doc to order an MRI (which I think I'll pay for). He says there's nothing he'd see in there besides a fracture or a tumor that'd be useful info (thanks for putting that idea in my head!)
Getting app't with endocrinologist. Will be fun to compare drugs. FATS!
Hey, the guy came and set up the bed. Good, because last night was painful. It's neat!
Back was good till I sneezed suddenly and didn't have time to brace properly. Now I am having spasms again in middle of night; therefore lost a week or more of healing.
Owen heard me screaming tonight and came upstairs. I could not get into my bed or move...but he couldn't help.
Hey, I'm standing more. I told Owen it was a victory to use the crutch to make it across 3' with no supports to the bed and he said, "small steps, Dad, but steps."
It's about same as 3 weeks ago I think. I get an X-ray tomorrow. Doc is predicting there's another compression fracture.

Today pretty good day. I'm taking ibuprofen again and timing it carefully to get some inflammation reduction yet keep dose to 1/2 Max or less. It actually is the best drug out of like 10 I have around!

I think I've isolated and calibrated the most important drug and dosage that helps: good 'ole ibuprofen. It appears to reduce inflammation enough to stop the spasms IF I take 1000mg in 24 hours. If I do 800mg, no cigar. All the other pain killers and anti-spasm muscle relaxers do NOTHING compared to it.
So I'm hoping the cancer doc is right that there's <1% chance I have Myeloma.

Date: December 23, 2014 at 4:17:21 PM PST Subject: Happy Holidays! Hi Everybody! 2014 can be summarized for us as: “Good Times, Bad Times”
EMERGENCY NUMBERS

Allogenic is currently the only way for me to survive past 5 years with odds of better than 35% according to the below. However, the phase 1 immunotherapy trials are trying to do the same thing. Timing is right! - See more at: http://www.cancerresearch.org/cancer-immunotherapy/impacting-all-cancers/multiple-myeloma#.dpuf

MY GOALS FOR MY CANCER TREATMENT: •Buy me 5 years of remission in order to get to phase 3 of new immunotherapy trials •At least 4 of which are normal quality of life (i.e., transplant can cause maybe >1 year of reduced quality or permanent)* •Instead, consider maintenance therapies to get to 5 years if there is a high probability that they will maintain the remission** •Still harvest for autologous when M-protein down to best low plateau on current RVD or other cycle •Still do bone marrow donor set up
* physical AND mental. ** Assuming there's a fallback to another transplant if relapse
RVD maintenance vs Stem Cell Transplant Trial for people <= 65 years old https://clinicaltrials.gov/ct2/show/NCT01208662
